edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.memory

Class BufferedMemoryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.memory.AbstractMemoryManager
      • edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.memory.BufferedMemoryManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MemoryManager

    public class BufferedMemoryManager
extends AbstractMemoryManager
    Inserts into the memory store in batches. Only one instance per executor.

      • init

        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager

      • append

        public boolean append(int opID,
                      java.nio.ByteBuffer key,
                      java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Appends the given byte buffer to the current value in the store. If the store does not contain the given key append works as a put operation
        Parameters:
        opID - id value of the operation
        key - key to append to
        value - value to be appended
        Returns:
        true if append was performed, false otherwise

                                           DataMessageType type,

      • removeOperation

        public boolean removeOperation(int opID)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Remove an operation from the memory manager. This will result in loss of all the data related to the operation in the memory manager
        Parameters:
        opID - operation id to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the operation was removed, false otherwise

      • registerKey

        public boolean registerKey(int opID,
                           java.lang.String key,
                           int step)
        Register the key
        Parameters:
        key - key value to be registered
        step - the step size. The Memory manager will write to the store once this value is reached
        Returns:
        true if the key was registered and false if the key is already present

      • registerKey

        public boolean registerKey(int opID,
                           java.lang.String key)

      • putBulk

        public boolean putBulk(int opID,
                       java.lang.String key,
                       java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
        Buffers the inputs before submitting it to the store. If the value is already present it will be replaced

      • appendBulk

        public boolean appendBulk(int opID,
                          java.lang.String key,
                          java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
        Buffers the inputs before submitting to the store. The new values will be appended to the end

      • flush

        public boolean flush(int opID,
                     java.nio.ByteBuffer key)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        Flush all the data into the store. This method is needed only if buffering is done at the Memory Manager
        Parameters:
        opID - id of the operation
        key - key to be flushed

      • flush

        public boolean flush(int opID,
                     java.lang.String key)
        Makes sure all the data that is held in the BufferedMemoryManager is pushed into the memory store

      • flush

        public boolean flush(int opID)

      • flush

        public boolean flush(int opID,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.nio.ByteBuffer last)
        Slight variation of flush for so that the last ByteBuffer does not need to be copied into the map
        Parameters:
        key - key to flush
        last - the last value that needs to be appended to the ByteBuffers that correspond to the given key

      • flushAll

        public boolean flushAll(int opID)
        Flush all the keys that are stored for the given operation id. this must be called before a range of keys will be read as in the iterator methods

      • close

        public boolean close(int opID,
                     java.nio.ByteBuffer key)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryManager
        flush and close the given key. After close is performed the key data will only be available in the store. This method is needed only if buffering is done at the Memory Manager
        Parameters:
        opID - id of the operation
        key - key to be closed

      • close

        public boolean close(int opID,
                     java.lang.String key)
        Closing the key will make the BufferedMemoryManager to flush the current data into the store and delete all the key information. This is done once we know that no more values will be sent for this key

      • getIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> getIterator(int opID,
                                                        DataMessageType keyType,
                                                        DataMessageType valueType,
                                                        KryoSerializer deSerializer,
